mark Tarique Rahman’s return1d agoTarique’s return rekindles hope for democracyLeaders of different political parties yesterday welcomed BNP acting chairman Tarique Rahman, expressing hope that his return would put the country back on the path of democracy and elections and usher in a culture of political coexistence.1d agoMother, son reunite at EvercareBNP Chairperson Khaleda Zia met her elder son Tarique Rahma at Evercare Hospital in Dhaka yesterday after a separation of more than seven and a half months as the party’s acting chairman returned home, ending a 17-year exile.1d ago‘NCP leaning towards seat-sharing deal with Jamaat’The National Citizen Party is increasingly tilting toward a seat-sharing arrangement with Jamaat-e-Islami, as party leaders fear that a deal with the BNP would yield too few seats and create cracks within their newly formed alliance.1d agoRaozan in Chattogram: New market unused as vendors clog highwayA newly constructed kitchen market in the Gohira area of Raozan municipality in Chattogram has remained unused for nearly a year despite shops being handed over to the vendors.1d agoTarique returns to a roaring receptionSix thousand, three hundred and fourteen days.1d ago‘Feels like Eid’BNP leaders and activists are energised by the party’s Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman’s speech, which has brought new hope and clear direction ahead of the upcoming election.1d agoA bride for 17 days, Salma’s life ends too soonJust 17 days ago, 18-year-old Salma Akter Smriti got married over the phone to an expatriate living in Oman. The couple had planned for a formal wedding reception in Bangladesh during Ramadan, once he returned.1d ago+ MoreJournalism without fear or favourAbout UsContact UsAppsComment PolicyRSSSitemapAdvertisementNewsletterPrivacy PolicyConference HallArchives© 2025 thedailystar.net | Powered by:RSI LABCopyright: Any unauthorized use or reproduction of The Daily Star content for commercial purposes is strictly prohibited and constitutes copyright infringement liable to legal action. documents.body: Skip to main content E-paperবাংলা Investigative StoriesInvestigative StoriesAL govt’s secret surveillance stateFrom snooping devices carried in backpacks to locate people through their phones to a massive infrastructure that can intercept even end-to-end encryption from a central command centre, the Awami League government had been on an increasingly aggressive trajectory towards building a powerful surveillance state.4m agoBangladesh Police: Equipped to inflict heavy casualtiesPolice arms records show the brutal truth behind the July killings; the force bought 7 times more lethal weapons than non-lethal ones in 2021-234m agoVideo of রামপুরা হত্যাকাণ্ড: বিজিবি কি দায়ী? ভিডিও বিশ্লেষণ যা বলছে | BGB | Rampura MassacreAnatomy of BGB shootings in RampuraIt was 6:14pm on Friday, July 19, 2024. Two Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) personnel were advancing into Banasree G Block in Dhaka.4m agoInvestigation/ 'Shoot directly': Hasina’s order and deadly aftermathMonths-long investigation by The Daily Star indicates state forces increased deployment of lethal weapons after the ousted PM authorised their use5m agoInvestigation/ Licence to fly: Pilots faked flying recordsCAAB inquiry finds, regulator yet to take action7m agoInvestigation/ Licence to fly: Regulator repeatedly ignored red flagsCAAB’s own inquiry finds irregularities by training academies, raising questions about aviation safety7m agoThe disappeared of the July UprisingThe Daily Star found evidence of systematic government efforts to cover up medical records and bodies of the July uprising victims so they can never be found again.9m agoThe disappeared of the July Uprising: Part 4/ Families want closure, however painfulWhen we first started visiting Dhaka Medical College Hospital in January for this story, there were seven protest-related unclaimed bodies freezing in its mortuaries.9m agoA blatant river grabConfluence of Dhaleshwari and Shitalakkhya under siege from Shah Cement6m agoHastily buried in unmarked gravesThe Daily Star investigates how July uprising protesters were disappeared in unmarked graves9m agoVideo of দুবাইয়ে বাংলাদেশি মালিকানাধীন বিপুল সম্পদের মালিক কারা?Parking wealth under the Dubai sunThe city’s booming real estate has also been used by Bangladeshis as an offshore haven to park wealth for a big reason11m agoHow Hasina’s flight was kept off radarWhen the air force transporter plane carrying Sheikh Hasina left Dhaka on August 5, it took off as a training flight and turned off its transponders to blur its flightpath and location..The transponders, which transmit location, heading1y agoVideo of বিদেশী ব্র্যান্ডের নকল সিগারেটে ছেয়ে গেছে বাংলাদেশ!A councillor and his illicit tobacco tradeA significant share of Bangladesh’s illegal cigarette market is controlled by two companies where Chattogram City Corporation (CCC) Councillor Abdus Sabur Liton and his brother have the majority stakes, an investigation by The Daily Star has found.1y ago20 plates of rice, 118 plates  of curries for a lunch of 4!NRBC Bank’s top managers have great appetites.1y agoDubious reward for a select fewOnly a select 27 employees of NRBC Bank were given salary hikes, and that too astonishingly, in 2022 in violation of banking rules as well as NRBC’s own human resources policy1y agoNRBC branch covered up capital flightExport proceeds worth at least $3.45 million (Tk 34.41 crore) were not repatriated by six customers of NRB Commercial Bank’s Uttara branch, and the bank concealed the trail of the capital flight, according to the bank’s internal audit and case documents.1y agoVideo of বোর্ডরুমে বন্দুক - কি বললেন এনআরবিসি ব্যাংকের চেয়ারম্যান?Gun in NRBC Bank boardroomDuring the 40th board meeting of NRBC Bank on February 7, 2016, current Chairman Tamal Parvez and Director Adnan Imam entered the boardroom accompanied by a man carrying a large gun. Both Tamal and Adnan were board directors back then.1y agoSex trafficking: The untold exploitations of Bangladeshi women in IndiaMany Bangladeshi sex workers, once victims themselves, now serve as brothel managers, perpetuating the vicious cycle. They employ fellow countrywomen, who later become traffickers responsible for bringing new girls from Bangladesh into the clutches of these brothels.1y ago+ MoreJournalism without fear or favourAbout UsContact UsAppsComment PolicyRSSSitemapAdvertisementNewsletterPrivacy PolicyConference HallArchives© 2025 thedailystar.net | Powered by:RSI LABCopyright: Any unauthorized use or reproduction of The Daily Star content for commercial purposes is strictly prohibited and constitutes copyright infringement liable to legal action. 118 plates  of curries for a lunch of 4!NRBC Bank’s top managers have great appetites.1y agoDubious reward for a select fewOnly a select 27 employees of NRBC Bank were given salary hikes, and that too astonishingly, in 2022 in violation of banking rules as well as NRBC’s own human resources policy1y agoNRBC branch covered up capital flightExport proceeds worth at least $3.45 million (Tk 34.41 crore) were not repatriated by six customers of NRB Commercial Bank’s Uttara branch, and the bank concealed the trail of the capital flight, according to the bank’s internal audit and case documents.1y agoVideo of বোর্ডরুমে বন্দুক - কি বললেন এনআরবিসি ব্যাংকের চেয়ারম্যান?Gun in NRBC Bank boardroomDuring the 40th board meeting of NRBC Bank on February 7, 2016, current Chairman Tamal Parvez and Director Adnan Imam entered the boardroom accompanied by a man carrying a large gun. Both Tamal and Adnan were board directors back then.1y agoSex trafficking: The untold exploitations of Bangladeshi women in IndiaMany Bangladeshi sex workers, once victims themselves, now serve as brothel managers, perpetuating the vicious cycle. documents.body: Skip to main content E-paperবাংলা NewsAsiaBangladeshInvestigative StoriesWorldAsiaBangladeshInvestigative StoriesWorldMyanmar sets late January date for final election roundMyanmar's junta will stage the third and final round of its heavily restricted elections on January 25, a statement said Thursday, just days before polls open for the first batch of ballots1d agoIndian state of Assam/ Tribal pushback over ‘illegal settlers’ kills 2Violent tribal protests against illegal non-tribal settlement in a constitutionally protected hill region of Assam left two people dead Tuesday - as Sixth Schedule protections and land rights ignited a volatile fault line.2d ago6.0-magnitude earthquake hits Taiwan: USGSTaiwan is frequently hit by earthquakes due to its location on the edge of two tectonic plates2d agoThai border clashes hit tourism at Cambodia's AngkorThe UNESCO heritage site lies in Siem Reap city, just a two-hour drive from the Thai border, which for more than two weeks has been roiled by military combat that has killed dozens2d agoMyanmar nationals caught with 10 drones in Bangkok: policeFour Myanmar nationals caught in Bangkok yesterday with 10 heavy-lift cargo drones they allegedly planned to smuggle home will be deported to Myanmar, Thai police said.3d agoIndia summons Bangladesh high commissioner for the second time in a weekIndian envoy was summoned by Bangladesh earlier today3d agoCambodia asks Thailand to move border talks to MalaysiaThe two countries set to negotiate truce terms after two weeks of deadly border clashes3d agoEx-junta prisoner runs for Suu Kyi's seat in Myanmar electionMyanmar parliamentary candidate Kyaw Kyaw Htwe was once jailed by the junta for pro-democracy activism3d agoJapan’s flagship H3 rocket fails to launch satelliteJapan’s flagship H3 rocket failed to launch a geolocation satellite into orbit yesterday due to engine failure, the country’s space agency said.Pakistan strikes $4 billion deal to sell weapons to Libyan force, officials sayThe deal is one of Pakistan's largest-ever weapons salesBangladesh High Commission in New Delhi suspends all consular and visa servicesSoutheast Asia bloc meets to press Thailand, Cambodia on truceIndonesia bus crash kills 16, rescuer saysMalaysia court dismisses ex-PM Najib’s bid to serve sentence under house arrestGraft case: Pak ex-PM Imran calls for protest after yet another verdictOver 500,000 displaced in Cambodia by Thai border clashes: interior ministryMore than half a million people in Cambodia have been displaced from their homes by two weeks of deadly border clashes with neighbouring Thailand, Phnom Penh's interior ministry said Sunday7 elephants killed in India train accidentSeven elephants were killed and one injured when a Delhi-bound train collided with a herd in northeast India early yesterday, district police chief VV Rakesh Reddy said.6d agoGraft Case: Court hands Imran 17-year jail termA Pakistani court yesterday sentenced former Prime Minister Imran Khan and his wife Bushra Bibi to 17 years in prison each in a corruption case involving the under-priced purchase of luxury state gifts.6d agoChina’s rare-earth magnet exports hit second-highest ever in NovChina’s exports of rare-earth magnets rose to the second-highest level on record in November, the first full month after the US and China agreed to streamline exports of the elements.6d agoImran Khan, his wife sentenced to 17 years in Toshakhana-2 caseA special court in Pakistan on Saturday sentenced PTI founder Imran Khan and his wife Bushra Bibi to 17 years imprisonment in the Toshakhana-2 case6d ago4 security forces personnel killed in attack on camp in Pakistan's North WaziristanThe Pakistan ISPR says the car bomb attack inflicted damage to nearby homes and other structures and inflicted severe injuries to fifteen local civilians6d agoDelhi bans tandoors in its fight against air pollutionThe humble tandoor, used to prepare rotis and roasted delights, has become the latest target of Delhi’s pollution fight. The Delhi Pollution Control Committee (DPCC) issued directions banning tandoors that use coal and firewood across all hotels, restaurants and open eateries in the city.1w agoNepal’s ousted PM Oli re-elected as party leaderMembers of ousted Nepali prime minister KP Sharma Oli’s political party voted for him to retain leadership of the organisation yesterday, meaning he will oversee its preparations for national elections next year.1w agoThailand bombs casino hub on border: CambodiaCambodia said Thailand’s military yesterday bombed the casino town of Poipet, a major crossing between the two nations, as foreign powers pressured them to halt reignited border clashes.1w agoCambodia says Thai military bombs Poipet casino hub on borderThailand has not commented on the strike as of early Thursday afternoon1w agoImran’s sons planning to visit Pakistan in January, say ex-premier being held in ‘death cell’The duo also shared that they were looking to do more advocacy and visit Brussels or Geneva in January to speak to politicians and officials about Imran’s situation1w ago+ MoreJournalism without fear or favourAbout UsContact UsAppsComment PolicyRSSSitemapAdvertisementNewsletterPrivacy PolicyConference HallArchives© 2025 thedailystar.net | Powered by:RSI LABCopyright: Any unauthorized use or reproduction of The Daily Star content for commercial purposes is strictly prohibited and constitutes copyright infringement liable to legal action. documents.title: News
documents.body: Skip to main content E-paperবাংলা NewsWorldBangladeshInvestigative StoriesAsiaWorldBangladeshInvestigative StoriesAsiaUS says it struck Islamic State militants in northwest NigeriaTrump has warned of threat to Christians in West African country16h agoKSA urges Yemen separatists to cede seized territorySaudi Arabia, the main backer of Yemen’s internationally recognised government, said yesterday that Yemeni separatists should return territory seized recently, adding that it seeks to deescalate tensions within the government camp.1d agoIsraeli strike hits vehicle near Syria borderLebanon said an Israeli strike near the border with Syria killed two people yesterday, as a deadline nears for Lebanon’s army to disarm Hezbollah in the country’s south.1d agoDISPUTED ELECTION/ Trump-backed Asfura wins Honduras presidencyNasry Asfura, the conservative candidate for Honduran president backed by US President Donald Trump, was declared the winner on Wednesday more than three weeks after the November 30 election, which was beset by delays, technical problems and allegations of fraud.1d agoIndian forces kill Maoist rebel leaderIndian security forces killed a senior Maoist rebel commander and three other fighters including two women in a raid yesterday, police said, as authorities push a major offensive against the guerrillas.1d agoChina accuses US of hindering China-India tiesChina yesterday accused the US of distorting its defence policy in an effort to thwart an improvement in China-India ties.1d agoFocus on ‘quarantine’ of Venezuela oilThe White House has ordered US military forces to focus almost exclusively on enforcing a “quarantine” of Venezuelan oil for at least the next two months, a US official told Reuters, indicating Washington is currently more interested in using economic rather than military means to pressure Caracas.1d agoCHRISTMAS HOMILY/ Pope condemns ‘open wounds’ of warPope Leo XIV condemned the “senselessness” of war and the “open wounds” it leaves behind, as he delivered his first Christmas message yesterday after a year marked by conflict but also hopes for peace in Gaza and Ukraine.1d agoRussia makes ‘proposal’ to France over jailed researcherMoscow has made an offer to Paris regarding jailed French researcher Laurent Vinatier, who is facing espionage charges that could see him sentenced to 20 years in a Russian prison, the Kremlin said yesterday.Turkey detains 115 alleged IS membersSome 115 alleged members of the Islamic State group suspected of planning attacks during the end of year holidays have been arrested in Turkey, Istanbul’s prosecutor general said yesterday.Pacific archipelago Palau agrees to take migrants from USMIGRANT CRISIS/ Coastguard rescues 52 off GreeceFive killed in Nigeria mosque blastIran Guards seize foreign-crewed tanker in GulfMigrant Crisis: 12 die as boat sinks off SenegalTurkey detains 115 alleged IS membersSome 115 alleged members of the Islamic State group suspected of planning attacks during the end-of-year holidays have been arrested in Turkey, Istanbul's prosecutor general said on ThursdayRussia is analysing US documents on Ukraine peace dealSaid Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov1d agoFive killed in Nigeria mosque attack, police sayBomb disposal teams have cordoned off the area1d agoWhite House orders military to focus on 'quarantine' of Venezuela oilWhite House ordered US military forces to focus exclusively on enforcing a "quarantine" for at least next two months1d agoTrump-backed Nasry Asfura declared winner of Honduras presidencyNasry Asfura was declared winner, weeks after a razor-thin election marred by delays and allegations of fraud1d agoThailand, Cambodia hold talks on resuming truceCambodian and Thai officials began four days of talks at a border checkpoint yesterday aimed at negotiating an end to deadly clashes, Phnom Penh said.2d agoIsraeli army demolishes home of PalestinianThe Israeli army yesterday demolished the home of a Palestinian accused of carrying out a stabbing and shooting attack that killed an Israeli earlier this year, the military said.2d agoRussian invasion: Zelensky reveals US-Ukraine plan to end warUkraine won some concessions in the latest version of a US-led draft plan to end the Russian invasion, revealed by President Volodymyr Zelensky, though key questions remain over territory and whether Moscow could accept the new terms.2d ago6.1 earthquake hits southeast TaiwanAn earthquake with a magnitude of 6.1 struck Taiwan’s southeastern coastal county of Taitung documents.title: ‘We will stay at Shahbagh throughout the night’
documents.body: Skip to main content  E-paperবাংলা BangladeshDU CorrespondentFri Dec 26, 2025 03:55 PMLast update on: Sat Dec 27, 2025 12:12 AMMost Viewed'This country belongs to people of the hills and plains, Muslims, Hindus, Buddhists and Christians'Tarique Rahman returns home after 17 years in exileA psychological reset for BNP, a moment of political recalibration for BangladeshZubaida, daughter Zaima reach Gulshan residenceBangladeshBangladesh‘We will stay at Shahbagh throughout the night’Fri Dec 26, 2025 03:55 PMLast update on: Sat Dec 27, 2025 12:12 AMInqilab Moncho demands justice for Hadi; protesters say they’d continue the blockadeDU CorrespondentFri Dec 26, 2025 03:55 PM      Last update on: Sat Dec 27, 2025 12:12 AMPhoto: StarInqilab Moncho demands justice for Hadi; protesters say they’d continue the blockadeInqilab Moncho today blocked Shahbagh demanding justice for the killing of Sharif Osman Bin Hadi.After Juma prayers, leaders and activists of Inqilab Moncho and July Moncho, along with general students and public, brought out a protest procession from the Dhaka University Central Mosque and marched to Shahbagh, where they staged a sit-in.For all latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel.Inqilab Moncho member secretary Abdullah Al Jaber said that the sit-in will continue throughout the night.Photo: Star"We will stay at Shahbagh throughout the night. We have already arranged for blankets. Hadi bought the blankets for the poor when he was alive but could not distribute those," Jaber said.As of 11:15pm, the blockade was still ongoing. The demonstrators blocked the road, halting vehicular movement in the area.Photo: StarEarlier, the Inqilab Moncho member secretary announced that they would continue the Shahbagh blockade until the perpetrators are brought to justice."People from all over the country will join us by tomorrow (Saturday) morning," he said.He also threatened a nationwide blockade if the government fails to take immediate action.Read moreHadi Murder: One suspect remanded, another heldJaber called on political parties to unite for the trial of Osman Hadi's murder. "If you do not stand up for the trial of this murder, people of Bangladesh will assume that you too have a hand in it," he said.From the sit-in, the platform reiterated its three-point demand: forming a speedy trial tribunal and completing the trial within a maximum of 30 working days; ensuring an impartial investigation by involving internationally recognised professional agencies; identifying, arresting and prosecuting "Awami terrorists" allegedly hiding within civil and military intelligence agencies, and resignation of the home adviser, the special assistant and the law adviser.Photo: StarJaber emphasised that Osman Hadi's fight against cultural hegemony remains ongoing. "In line with Hadi's principles and objectives, this struggle will continue. It is a fight to protect our independence and sovereignty," he added.At Shahbagh, he declared the area as "Shaheed Osman Hadi Chottor" and said, "From today, this square will bear the name of Shaheed Osman Hadi. Our movement will remain on the streets until justice is served."The programme has seen participation from people of various social and professional backgrounds.Sharif Osman Hadi was shot in the capital's Bijoynagar area on December 12. He was first taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital and later shifted to Evercare Hospital. On December 15, he was flown to Singapore for advanced treatment, where he died while undergoing treatment on December 18.Related topic:Osman HadiClick to commentCommentsComments PolicyRelated NewsTens of thousands gather at Manik Mia Avenue ahead of Osman Hadi’s janaza6d agoHadi murder case to be tried at speedy tribunal4d agoHundreds of thousands join July frontliner Hadi's funeral as venue exceeds capacity6d agoNation mourns death of Hadi6d agoA sea of mourners bids Hadi a hero’s farewell6d ago|বাংলাদেশহাদি হত্যার বিচার দাবি: রাতে অবস্থান চলবে শাহবাগে, দেশব্যাপী অবরোধের হুঁশিয়ারিহাদি হত্যার ন্যায়বিচার নিশ্চিতে যা যা করা হয়েছে, উপদেষ্টাদের শাহবাগে এসে তার ব্যাখ্যা দেওয়ার দাবি জানিয়েছে ইনকিলাব মঞ্চ।৩৫ মিনিট আগে|রাজনীতিজাতীয় স্মৃতিসৌধে তারেক রহমানের শ্রদ্ধা নিবেদন১ ঘণ্টা আগেJournalism without fear or favourAbout UsContact UsAppsComment PolicyRSSSitemapAdvertisementNewsletterPrivacy PolicyConference HallArchives© 2025 thedailystar.net | Powered by:RSI LABCopyright: Any unauthorized use or reproduction of The Daily Star content for commercial purposes is strictly prohibited and constitutes copyright infringement liable to legal action. Shahbagh throughout the night’Fri Dec 26, 2025 03:55 PMLast update on: Sat Dec 27, 2025 12:12 AMInqilab Moncho demands justice for Hadi; protesters say they’d continue the blockadeDU CorrespondentFri Dec 26, 2025 03:55 PM      Last update on: Sat Dec 27, 2025 12:12 AMPhoto: StarInqilab Moncho demands justice for Hadi; protesters say they’d continue the blockadeInqilab Moncho today blocked Shahbagh demanding justice for the killing of Sharif Osman Bin Hadi.After Juma prayers, leaders and activists of Inqilab Moncho and July Moncho, along with general students and public, brought out a protest procession from the Dhaka University Central Mosque and marched to Shahbagh, where they staged a sit-in.For all latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel.Inqilab Moncho member secretary Abdullah Al Jaber said that the sit-in will continue throughout the night.Photo: Star"We will stay at Shahbagh throughout the night. We have already arranged for blankets. Hadi bought the blankets for the poor when he was alive but could not distribute those," Jaber said.As of 11:15pm, the blockade was still ongoing. The demonstrators blocked the road, halting vehicular movement in the area.Photo: StarEarlier, the Inqilab Moncho member secretary announced that they would continue the Shahbagh blockade until the perpetrators are brought to justice."People from all over the country will join us by tomorrow (Saturday) morning," he said.He also threatened a nationwide blockade if the government fails to take immediate action.Read moreHadi Murder: One suspect remanded, another heldJaber called on political parties to unite for the trial of Osman Hadi's murder. "If you do not stand up for the trial of this murder, people of Bangladesh will assume that you too have a hand in it," he said.From the sit-in, the platform reiterated its three-point demand: forming a speedy trial tribunal and completing the trial within a maximum of 30 working days; ensuring an impartial investigation by involving internationally recognised professional agencies; identifying, arresting and prosecuting "Awami terrorists" allegedly hiding within civil and military intelligence agencies, and resignation of the home adviser, the special assistant and the law adviser.Photo: StarJaber emphasised that Osman Hadi's fight against cultural hegemony remains ongoing. "In line with Hadi's principles and objectives, this struggle will continue. It is a fight to protect our independence and sovereignty," he added.At Shahbagh, he declared the area as "Shaheed Osman Hadi Chottor" and said, "From today, this square will bear the name of Shaheed Osman Hadi. Our movement will remain on the streets until justice is served."The programme has seen participation from people of various social and professional backgrounds.Sharif Osman Hadi was shot in the capital's Bijoynagar area on December 12. He was first taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital and later shifted to Evercare Hospital. On December 15, he was flown to Singapore for advanced treatment, where he died while undergoing treatment on December 18.Related topic:Osman HadiClick to commentCommentsComments Policy  BangladeshBangladesh‘We will stay at Shahbagh throughout the night’Fri Dec 26, 2025 03:55 PMLast update on: Sat Dec 27, 2025 12:12 AMInqilab Moncho demands justice for Hadi; protesters say they’d continue the blockadeDU CorrespondentFri Dec 26, 2025 03:55 PM      Last update on: Sat Dec 27, 2025 12:12 AMPhoto: StarInqilab Moncho demands justice for Hadi; protesters say they’d continue the blockadeInqilab Moncho today blocked Shahbagh demanding justice for the killing of Sharif Osman Bin Hadi.After Juma prayers, leaders and activists of Inqilab Moncho and July Moncho, along with general students and public, brought out a protest procession from the Dhaka University Central Mosque and marched to Shahbagh, where they staged a sit-in.For all latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel.Inqilab Moncho member secretary Abdullah Al Jaber said that the sit-in will continue throughout the night.Photo: Star"We will stay at Shahbagh throughout the night. documents.title: Tarique Rahman pays tribute to Liberation War martyrs at Savar National Memorial
documents.body: Skip to main content  E-paperবাংলা PoliticsOur Correspondent, SavarFri Dec 26, 2025 10:26 PMLast update on: Sat Dec 27, 2025 12:39 AMMost Viewed'This country belongs to people of the hills and plains, Muslims, Hindus, Buddhists and Christians'Tarique Rahman returns home after 17 years in exileA psychological reset for BNP, a moment of political recalibration for BangladeshZubaida, daughter Zaima reach Gulshan residencePoliticsPoliticsTarique Rahman pays tribute to Liberation War martyrs at Savar National MemorialFri Dec 26, 2025 10:26 PMLast update on: Sat Dec 27, 2025 12:39 AMSigns visitors' book, headed towards DhakaOur Correspondent, SavarFri Dec 26, 2025 10:26 PM      Last update on: Sat Dec 27, 2025 12:39 AMPhoto: BNP Media CellSigns visitors' book, headed towards DhakaBNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman visited the National Memorial in Savar on Friday night to pay tribute to the Liberation War martyrs.A bus carrying him entered the main entrance of the memorial around 10:04pm, our correspondent reported from the spot.For all latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel.Dhaka district BNP President Khandaker Abu Ashfaq told The Daily Star that after reaching the National Memorial, Tarique Rahman observed a one‑minute silence in honour of the martyrs.Photo: BNP Media CellHe then thanked the party leaders, activists, and law enforcers who had been waiting for him for a long time, Ashfaq added.Afterwards, the BNP acting chairman boarded the bus and signed the visitors' book of the memorial. He later headed towards his Dhaka residence.Photo: BNP Media CellEarlier, senior BNP leaders, on Tarique's behalf, paid tribute to the martyrs of the Liberation War by placing a wreath at the memorial earlier this afternoon.They placed a wreath at the altar of the memorial around 5:06pm as Tarique was delayed after visiting the grave of his father and BNP founder Ziaur Rahman, said Standing Committee member Gayeshwar Chandra Roy.Talking to reporters in front of the National Memorial around 5:45pm, Gayeshwar also said that after visiting the grave of Ziaur Rahman, Tarique Rahman left for the Savar memorial. Since there is a rule that wreaths must be placed before sunset, they placed it on his behalf at 5:06pm.Besides, Gayeshwar, BNP Standing Committee member Abdul Moin Khan, BNP Chairperson's Advisory Council members Amanullah Aman and Lutfuzzaman Babar; Dhaka district BNP President Khandaker Abu Ashfaq; and General Secretary Advocate Nipun Roy Chowdhury, among others, were also present.Click to commentCommentsComments Policy|বাংলাদেশহাদি হত্যার বিচার দাবি: রাতে অবস্থান চলবে শাহবাগে, দেশব্যাপী অবরোধের হুঁশিয়ারিহাদি হত্যার ন্যায়বিচার নিশ্চিতে যা যা করা হয়েছে, উপদেষ্টাদের শাহবাগে এসে তার ব্যাখ্যা দেওয়ার দাবি জানিয়েছে ইনকিলাব মঞ্চ।৩৫ মিনিট আগে|রাজনীতিজাতীয় স্মৃতিসৌধে তারেক রহমানের শ্রদ্ধা নিবেদন১ ঘণ্টা আগেJournalism without fear or favourAbout UsContact UsAppsComment PolicyRSSSitemapAdvertisementNewsletterPrivacy PolicyConference HallArchives© 2025 thedailystar.net | Powered by:RSI LABCopyright: Any unauthorized use or reproduction of The Daily Star content for commercial purposes is strictly prohibited and constitutes copyright infringement liable to legal action. leaders, activists, and law enforcers who had been waiting for him for a long time, Ashfaq added.Afterwards, the BNP acting chairman boarded the bus and signed the visitors' book of the memorial. He later headed towards his Dhaka residence.Photo: BNP Media CellEarlier, senior BNP leaders, on Tarique's behalf, paid tribute to the martyrs of the Liberation War by placing a wreath at the memorial earlier this afternoon.They placed a wreath at the altar of the memorial around 5:06pm as Tarique was delayed after visiting the grave of his father and BNP founder Ziaur Rahman, said Standing Committee member Gayeshwar Chandra Roy.Talking to reporters in front of the National Memorial around 5:45pm, Gayeshwar also said that after visiting the grave of Ziaur Rahman, Tarique Rahman left for the Savar memorial. Since there is a rule that wreaths must be placed before sunset, they placed it on his behalf at 5:06pm.Besides, Gayeshwar, BNP Standing Committee member Abdul Moin Khan, BNP Chairperson's Advisory Council members Amanullah Aman and Lutfuzzaman Babar; Dhaka district BNP President Khandaker Abu Ashfaq; and General Secretary Advocate Nipun Roy Chowdhury, among others, were also present.Click to commentCommentsComments Policy  PoliticsPoliticsTarique Rahman pays tribute to Liberation War martyrs at Savar National MemorialFri Dec 26, 2025 10:26 PMLast update on: Sat Dec 27, 2025 12:39 AMSigns visitors' book, headed towards DhakaOur Correspondent, SavarFri Dec 26, 2025 10:26 PM      Last update on: Sat Dec 27, 2025 12:39 AMPhoto: BNP Media CellSigns visitors' book, headed towards DhakaBNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman visited the National Memorial in Savar on Friday night to pay tribute to the Liberation War martyrs.A bus carrying him entered the main entrance of the memorial around 10:04pm, our correspondent reported from the spot.For all latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel.Dhaka district BNP President Khandaker Abu Ashfaq told The Daily Star that after reaching the National Memorial, Tarique Rahman observed a one‑minute silence in honour of the martyrs.Photo: BNP Media CellHe then thanked the party leaders, activists, and law enforcers who had been waiting for him for a long time, Ashfaq added.Afterwards, the BNP acting chairman boarded the bus and signed the visitors' book of the memorial. Since there is a rule that wreaths must be placed before sunset, they placed it on his behalf at 5:06pm.Besides, Gayeshwar, BNP Standing Committee member Abdul Moin Khan, BNP Chairperson's Advisory Council members Amanullah Aman and Lutfuzzaman Babar; Dhaka district BNP President Khandaker Abu Ashfaq; and General Secretary Advocate Nipun Roy Chowdhury, among others, were also present.Click to commentCommentsComments Policy Fri Dec 26, 2025 10:26 PMLast update on: Sat Dec 27, 2025 12:39 AM Our Correspondent, SavarFri Dec 26, 2025 10:26 PM      Last update on: Sat Dec 27, 2025 12:39 AM  Click to comment   |বাংলাদেশহাদি হত্যার বিচার দাবি: রাতে অবস্থান চলবে শাহবাগে, দেশব্যাপী অবরোধের হুঁশিয়ারিহাদি হত্যার ন্যায়বিচার নিশ্চিতে যা যা করা হয়েছে, উপদেষ্টাদের শাহবাগে এসে তার ব্যাখ্যা দেওয়ার দাবি জানিয়েছে ইনকিলাব মঞ্চ।৩৫ মিনিট আগে|রাজনীতিজাতীয় স্মৃতিসৌধে তারেক রহমানের শ্রদ্ধা নিবেদন১ ঘণ্টা আগে |বাংলাদেশহাদি হত্যার বিচার দাবি: রাতে অবস্থান চলবে শাহবাগে, দেশব্যাপী অবরোধের হুঁশিয়ারিহাদি হত্যার ন্যায়বিচার নিশ্চিতে যা যা করা হয়েছে, উপদেষ্টাদের শাহবাগে এসে তার ব্যাখ্যা দেওয়ার দাবি জানিয়েছে ইনকিলাব মঞ্চ।৩৫ মিনিট আগে|রাজনীতিজাতীয় স্মৃতিসৌধে তারেক রহমানের শ্রদ্ধা নিবেদন১ ঘণ্টা আগে |বাংলাদেশহাদি হত্যার বিচার দাবি: রাতে অবস্থান চলবে শাহবাগে, দেশব্যাপী অবরোধের হুঁশিয়ারিহাদি হত্যার ন্যায়বিচার নিশ্চিতে যা যা করা হয়েছে, উপদেষ্টাদের শাহবাগে এসে তার ব্যাখ্যা দেওয়ার দাবি জানিয়েছে ইনকিলাব মঞ্চ।৩৫ মিনিট আগে |রাজনীতিজাতীয় স্মৃতিসৌধে তারেক রহমানের শ্রদ্ধা নিবেদন১ ঘণ্টা আগে     About UsContact UsAppsComment PolicyRSSSitemapAdvertisementNewsletterPrivacy PolicyConference HallArchives

documents.body: Skip to main content  E-paperবাংলা Crime & JusticeStar Online ReportFri Dec 26, 2025 10:15 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 10:32 PMMost Viewed'This country belongs to people of the hills and plains, Muslims, Hindus, Buddhists and Christians'Tarique Rahman returns home after 17 years in exileA psychological reset for BNP, a moment of political recalibration for BangladeshZubaida, daughter Zaima reach Gulshan residenceCrime & JusticeCrime & JusticeOne more arrested over attacks on Prothom Alo, The Daily Star officesFri Dec 26, 2025 10:15 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 10:32 PMTotal number of arrests in the incidents now 32Star Online ReportFri Dec 26, 2025 10:15 PM      Last update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 10:32 PMPhoto: Md AbbasPolice have arrested another individual in connection with the attack, looting, and arson at the offices of Prothom Alo and The Daily Star.With this, the total number of arrests in the cases rose to 32.For all latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel.The arrestee, identified as Athahar Ali alias Swapan, 33, was apprehended from Panchagarh on Thursday night, Tejgaon Police Station Officer-in-Charge (OC) Kya Shi Nyu Marma said tonight.The arrest was made with the assistance and information provided by Police Headquarters, said the OC.He said Athahar had uploaded sensitive videos and photographs of the attacks on the offices of Prothom Alo and The Daily Star on Facebook in an attempt to incite the public and encouraged others to share them widely.The OC added that Athahar has already been produced before a court.Click to commentCommentsComments Policy|বাংলাদেশহাদি হত্যার বিচার দাবি: রাতে অবস্থান চলবে শাহবাগে, দেশব্যাপী অবরোধের হুঁশিয়ারিহাদি হত্যার ন্যায়বিচার নিশ্চিতে যা যা করা হয়েছে, উপদেষ্টাদের শাহবাগে documents.title: Tarique Rahman offers prayers at father's grave after 19 years
documents.body: Skip to main content  E-paperবাংলা BangladeshStar Online ReportFri Dec 26, 2025 05:24 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 08:15 PMMost Viewed'This country belongs to people of the hills and plains, Muslims, Hindus, Buddhists and Christians'Tarique Rahman returns home after 17 years in exileA psychological reset for BNP, a moment of political recalibration for BangladeshZubaida, daughter Zaima reach Gulshan residenceBangladeshBangladeshTarique Rahman offers prayers at father's grave after 19 yearsFri Dec 26, 2025 05:24 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 08:15 PMStood alone for some time in front of the graveStar Online ReportFri Dec 26, 2025 05:24 PM      Last update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 08:15 PMPhoto: BNP Media CellStood alone for some time in front of the graveAfter 19 years, BNP Acting ChairmanTarique Rahmantoday visited the grave of his father and party founder Ziaur Rahman.Tarique, accompanied by senior party leaders, placed wreaths and offered prayers at the grave at 4:50pm.For all latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel.Members of the Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB), Rapid Action Battalion (Rab), police and the army barred media personnel and party activists from entering the grave area and its surroundings.Read more‘I have a plan’While Tarique was paying respects, party leaders and activists gathered in front of the entrance and chanted slogans.He stood alone for some time in front of his father's grave.Only senior party leaders were allowed inside the grave area.Ahead of Tarique's arrival, law enforcement personnel had been deployed in and around the area from 12:00pm.Visitors inside the park were kept at a safe distance, and no one was allowed to approach the grave.Around 1:00pm, a large number of party leaders and activists began gathering around the area, carrying banners and photographs of the party leader and joining small processions.Read moreTarique returns to a roaring receptionTarique left his Gulshan residence by bus and reached the grave area after nearly two hours. His convoy moved slowly from Bijoy Sarani to the grave amid heavy crowds of party leaders and activists.During the journey, Tarique waved to the gathered supportersParty sources said Tarique last visited Ziaur Rahman's grave on September 1, 2006.Related topic:Tarique Rahman's returnTarique Rahman return to BangladeshClick to commentCommentsComments PolicyRelated NewsTarique purchased one-way tickets for 6 people: Biman sources1w agoZubaida, daughter Zaima reach Gulshan residence1d agoTight security at Dhaka airport ahead of Tarique’s homecoming1d agoTarique on his way home2d agoBNP supporters gather outside Evercare ahead of Tarique Rahman’s visit1d ago|বাংলাদেশহাদি হত্যার বিচার দাবি: রাতে অবস্থান চলবে শাহবাগে, দেশব্যাপী অবরোধের হুঁশিয়ারিহাদি হত্যার ন্যায়বিচার নিশ্চিতে যা যা করা হয়েছে, উপদেষ্টাদের শাহবাগে এসে তার ব্যাখ্যা দেওয়ার দাবি জানিয়েছে ইনকিলাব মঞ্চ।৪১ মিনিট আগে|রাজনীতিজাতীয় স্মৃতিসৌধে তারেক রহমানের শ্রদ্ধা নিবেদন১ ঘণ্টা আগেJournalism without fear or favourAbout UsContact UsAppsComment PolicyRSSSitemapAdvertisementNewsletterPrivacy PolicyConference HallArchives© 2025 thedailystar.net | Powered by:RSI LABCopyright: Any unauthorized use or reproduction of The Daily Star content for commercial purposes is strictly prohibited and constitutes copyright infringement liable to legal action. documents.title: Shafiqur Rahman sets 3 conditions for electoral alliance with Jamaat
documents.body: Skip to main content  E-paperবাংলা PoliticsStar Online ReportFri Dec 26, 2025 05:51 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 07:02 PMMost Viewed'This country belongs to people of the hills and plains, Muslims, Hindus, Buddhists and Christians'Tarique Rahman returns home after 17 years in exileA psychological reset for BNP, a moment of political recalibration for BangladeshZubaida, daughter Zaima reach Gulshan residencePoliticsPoliticsShafiqur Rahman sets 3 conditions for electoral alliance with JamaatFri Dec 26, 2025 05:51 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 07:02 PMUrges Shibir to act as guardians of the student communityStar Online ReportFri Dec 26, 2025 05:51 PM      Last update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 07:02 PMFile photo of Shafiqur RahmanJamaat-e-Islami Ameer Shafiqur Rahman today said any political party can forge anelectoral alliance with Jamaatif it agrees to three conditions.The conditions are: refraining from corruption and from patronising corrupt individuals, ensuring equal justice for all at every level of society without any political interference in the judicial process, and committing to the implementation of all reform recommendations.For all latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel.He made the remarks while speaking as the chief guest at the central members' conference of Islami Chhatra Shibir, Jamaat's student wing, at the Bangladesh-China Friendship Conference Centre in Dhaka's Sher-e-Bangla Nagar.Read moreJamaat ameer collects nomination form for Dhaka-15Shafiqur said Jamaat wants to build an education system that leaves no one unemployed. "Jamaat aims to turn every pair of hands into skilled builders of the nation," he added.Urging Chhatra Shibir to act as guardians of the student community, the Jamaat ameer said, "For the last 54 years, pens were snatched from students' hands. Innocent students were misled and weapons were put in their hands. Educational institutions were turned into mini cantonments."He added, "There was no guarantee of women's dignity, or of students' lives and careers. That dark chapter has begun to recede. But its dark shadow has not yet lifted from the nation. Until this shadow is eliminated, Chhatra Shibir must continue its struggle."Addressing the conference, Jamaat Secretary General Mia Golam Porwar said, "Failing to confront Shibir with logic and ideology, the opposing forces have resorted to lies and propaganda. They have labelled Shibir as anti-independence, and 'rogkata', but failed to prove it. In student union elections at four public universities, the people rejected them."In the opening session, Omar Bin Hadi, elder brother of martyred Inqilab Moncho spokesperson Sharif Osman Hadi, also spoke. He said, "Not as Osman Hadi's brother, but as a fellow fighter, I want to say that it is you who must decide how Bangladesh will be built in the days ahead. If anyone retreats from here or collaborates with a neighbouring state or the deep state to help re-establish fascism in this country, you will be held accountable before Allah."He added, "May this Bangladesh be freed from hegemony in exchange for Osman Hadi's blood, and may justice be established in this country."Alongside other top Jamaat leaders, those present at the conference included Ashraf Ali Akon, presidium member of Islami Andolan Bangladesh; Mostafizur Rahman Iran, chairman of Bangladesh Labour Party; and Rashed Pradhan, spokesperson of Jatiya Ganotantrik Party (JAGPA), among others.Read moreSeat-sharing strains new allianceThe opening session, presided over by Chhatra Shibir Central President Zahidul Islam, was conducted by Central General Secretary Nurul Islam Saddam.In the second session of the conference, attended by several thousand Shibir members, Nurul Islam Saddam was elected president for the 2026 session through a vote of members.According to the organisation's constitution, the newly elected president nominated the secretary general. Accordingly, Sibgatullah has been appointed as the new secretary general of the student organisation.Related topic:Jamaat-e IslamiClick to commentCommentsComments PolicyRelated NewsDecision to hold polls, referendum on same day may trigger political crisis: Jamaat1m agoReferendum must be before polls to make charter effective: Jamaat1m ago‘Razakar’ branding misleads no one anymore: Jamaat leader Porwar3m agoActivists of Jamaat, 7 other parties gather at Paltan intersection1m ago'Govt prioritising music and dance over religious education, risking moral decline'3m ago|বাংলাদেশহাদি হত্যার বিচার দাবি: রাতে অবস্থান চলবে শাহবাগে, দেশব্যাপী অবরোধের হুঁশিয়ারিহাদি হত্যার ন্যায়বিচার নিশ্চিতে যা যা করা হয়েছে, উপদেষ্টাদের শাহবাগে এসে তার ব্যাখ্যা দেওয়ার দাবি জানিয়েছে ইনকিলাব মঞ্চ।৪১ মিনিট আগে|রাজনীতিজাতীয় স্মৃতিসৌধে তারেক রহমানের শ্রদ্ধা নিবেদন১ ঘণ্টা আগেJournalism without fear or favourAbout UsContact UsAppsComment PolicyRSSSitemapAdvertisementNewsletterPrivacy PolicyConference HallArchives© 2025 thedailystar.net | Powered by:RSI LABCopyright: Any unauthorized use or reproduction of The Daily Star content for commercial purposes is strictly prohibited and constitutes copyright infringement liable to legal action. Educational institutions were turned into mini cantonments."He added, "There was no guarantee of women's dignity, or of students' lives and careers. That dark chapter has begun to recede. But its dark shadow has not yet lifted from the nation. Until this shadow is eliminated, Chhatra Shibir must continue its struggle."Addressing the conference, Jamaat Secretary General Mia Golam Porwar said, "Failing to confront Shibir with logic and ideology, the opposing forces have resorted to lies and propaganda. They have labelled Shibir as anti-independence, and 'rogkata', but failed to prove it. In student union elections at four public universities, the people rejected them."In the opening session, Omar Bin Hadi, elder brother of martyred Inqilab Moncho spokesperson Sharif Osman Hadi, also spoke. He said, "Not as Osman Hadi's brother, but as a fellow fighter, I want to say that it is you who must decide how Bangladesh will be built in the days ahead. If anyone retreats from here or collaborates with a neighbouring state or the deep state to help re-establish fascism in this country, you will be held accountable before Allah."He added, "May this Bangladesh be freed from hegemony in exchange for Osman Hadi's blood, and may justice be established in this country."Alongside other top Jamaat leaders, those present at the conference included Ashraf Ali Akon, presidium member of Islami Andolan Bangladesh; Mostafizur Rahman Iran, chairman of Bangladesh Labour Party; and Rashed Pradhan, spokesperson of Jatiya Ganotantrik Party (JAGPA), among others.Read moreSeat-sharing strains new allianceThe opening session, presided over by Chhatra Shibir Central President Zahidul Islam, was conducted by Central General Secretary Nurul Islam Saddam.In the second session of the conference, attended by several thousand Shibir members, Nurul Islam Saddam was elected president for the 2026 session through a vote of members.According to the organisation's constitution, the newly elected president nominated the secretary general. Accordingly, Sibgatullah has been appointed as the new secretary general of the student organisation.Related topic:Jamaat-e IslamiClick to commentCommentsComments PolicyRelated NewsDecision to hold documents.title: Mahedi, Tanvir guide Chattogram to commanding win over Noakhali
documents.body: Skip to main content  E-paperবাংলা BPL 2026Sports ReporterFri Dec 26, 2025 11:47 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 11:55 PMMost Viewed'This country belongs to people of the hills and plains, Muslims, Hindus, Buddhists and Christians'Tarique Rahman returns home after 17 years in exileA psychological reset for BNP, a moment of political recalibration for BangladeshZubaida, daughter Zaima reach Gulshan residenceBPL 2026BPL 2026Mahedi, Tanvir guide Chattogram to commanding win over NoakhaliFri Dec 26, 2025 11:47 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 11:55 PMSports ReporterFri Dec 26, 2025 11:47 PM      Last update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 11:55 PMPhoto: FACEBOOKTanvir Islam and skipper Shak Mahedi Hasan delivered dominant performances as Chattogram Royals began their Bangladesh Premier League campaign with a comprehensive 65-run victory over Noakhali Express at the Sylhet International Cricket Stadium on Friday evening, on the opening day of the tournament.Despite the presence of dew, which was expected to make life difficult for spinners, both Mahedi and Tanvir struck early to put Noakhali on the back foot. After Shoriful Islam removed Habibur Rahman Sohan for 15, Noakhali slipped to 39 for three in just 4.5 overs, with Tanvir and Mahedi claiming wickets inside the Powerplay. Chattogram captain Mahedi later added to the pressure by dismissing the out-of-form Jaker Ali.For all latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel.Maaz Sadaqat (38) and Haider Ali (28) attempted to rebuild with a 32-run stand, but the resistance was short-lived. Maaz was dismissed by Abu Haider Rony, while Haider perished to Tanvir while attempting a third successive six. Tanvir finished with impressive figures of three for 39, while Mahedi returned two for 17. Pacers Shoriful Islam and Mukidul Islam then wrapped up the innings with two wickets apiece as Noakhali were bowled out for 109.Earlier, Chattogram named Pakistan top-order batter Mirza Tahir Baig and Afghanistan wicketkeeper-batter Masood Gurbaz in their playing XI, just managing to meet the foreign-player quota. Baig played a laborious knock as wickets fell around him, while skipper Mahedi provided late momentum with a brisk 26 off just 13 balls.Baig was dismissed off the final delivery of the innings after scoring 80 from 69 balls, as Chattogram posted 174 for six. Although his innings lacked fluency, it ultimately proved sufficient to hand the Royals a winning start to their BPL campaign.Related topic:Chattogram RoyalsNoakhali ExpressBPLBPL 12Bangladesh Premier LeagueClick to commentCommentsComments PolicyRelated NewsNaim highest amongst locals, Shanaka top in foreign category3w agoThe auction returns. documents.title: Yonex-Sunrise Bangladesh Int'l Series: Gaurab–Tanvir crowned men’s doubles champions
documents.body: Skip to main content  E-paperবাংলা More SportsStar Sports ReportFri Dec 26, 2025 10:37 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 11:04 PMMost Viewed'This country belongs to people of the hills and plains, Muslims, Hindus, Buddhists and Christians'Tarique Rahman returns home after 17 years in exileA psychological reset for BNP, a moment of political recalibration for BangladeshZubaida, daughter Zaima reach Gulshan residenceMore SportsMore SportsYonex-Sunrise Bangladesh Int'l Series: Gaurab–Tanvir crowned men’s doubles championsFri Dec 26, 2025 10:37 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 11:04 PMStar Sports ReportFri Dec 26, 2025 10:37 PM      Last update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 11:04 PMPhoto: BBFBangladesh's Gaurab Singha and Abdul Zahir Tanvir clinched the men's doubles title at the Yonex-Sunrise Bangladesh International Series, winning an all-Bangladesh final at the Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Indoor Stadium on Friday.In a tightly contested final, the Gaurab–Tanvir pair edged past Mizanur Rahman and Rahatun Naim 21-19, 17-21 and 22-20 to lift the trophy.For all latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel.The opening set was fiercely competitive, with Gaurab and Tanvir narrowly taking it 21-19. Momentum shifted in the second set after the change of courts, as Mizanur and Naim began to string together points. Despite falling behind 7-1 at one stage, Gaurab and Tanvir fought back to take a 15-13 lead. However, Mizanur and Naim regained control to win the set 21-17, levelling the match at one set apiece.The decider proved equally gripping. With both pairs locked at 20-20, Gaurab and Tanvir held their nerve, winning two consecutive points to seal the set 22-20 and secure the championship with a 2-1 victory.In a post-match announcement, Bangladesh Badminton Federation president Habib Ullah Dawn said that the federation would provide additional financial incentives for the finalists."We had earlier announced a prize of USD 1,000 for Al Amin Juma and Urmi Akter for reaching the mixed doubles final of the International Badminton Challenge. This time, as two of our pairs contested the men's doubles final of the International Series, we will discuss within the federation and announce separate financial rewards to encourage them," he said.Related topic:Yonex-Sunrise Bangladesh International SeriesGaurab SinghaAbdul Zahir TanvirClick to commentCommentsComments Policy|বাংলাদেশহাদি হত্যার বিচার দাবি: রাতে অবস্থান চলবে শাহবাগে, দেশব্যাপী অবরোধের হুঁশিয়ারিহাদি হত্যার ন্যায়বিচার নিশ্চিতে যা যা করা হয়েছে, উপদেষ্টাদের শাহবাগে এসে তার ব্যাখ্যা দেওয়ার দাবি জানিয়েছে ইনকিলাব মঞ্চ।৪১ মিনিট আগে|রাজনীতিজাতীয় স্মৃতিসৌধে তারেক রহমানের শ্রদ্ধা নিবেদন১ ঘণ্টা আগেJournalism without fear or favourAbout UsContact UsAppsComment PolicyRSSSitemapAdvertisementNewsletterPrivacy PolicyConference HallArchives© 2025 thedailystar.net | Powered by:RSI LABCopyright: Any unauthorized use or reproduction of The Daily Star content for commercial purposes is strictly prohibited and constitutes copyright infringement liable to legal action. Skip to main content  E-paperবাংলা Nurjahan Begum at 100: A life for women’s voicesIn FocusIn FocusOriginally published on May 20, 2016, this article is being reprinted to celebrate the 100th birth anniversary of Nurjahan Begum, the editor and publisher of Begum, the first magazine for Bangalee Muslim women.ByTamanna KhanThu Dec 25, 2025 04:20 PMLast update on: Thu Dec 25, 2025 04:58 PMThe colourful and picturesque pages of the National Geographic magazines were what enchanted little "Nuri" and sowed the seed of journalism in her.She developed such a keen interest for the foreign and local magazines and books that her father, Mohammad Nasiruddin, renowned journalist and editor of the monthly Shawgat, brought so that she could file the publications separately just by looking at the pictures, even before she had learned to read properly.Although little Nuri, initially named as Nurun Nahar, was born in Chalitatali village of Chandpur district on June 4, 1925, two accidents brought her to Kolkata, the cultural hub of the then Bengal.The strict, conservative Muslim families of East Bengal then used to view Kolkata as a city which beguiled women from religious path. So when Nasiruddin, who was then in Kolkata publishing Shawgat on his own initiative, wanted to bring his wife and daughter to him, he faced strong opposition from his family. But Nasiruddin was adamant, especially after Nuri had met with drowning accidents twice in the village.Nurjahan with her father journalist Md Nasiruddin.So in 1929, Nurun Nahar came to Kolkata with her mother Fatema Begum and an uncle. The sights and sounds of Kolkata dazzled Nuri and her father set his mission to modernise his daughter into a progressive-minded, confident woman who can fight against the deep-rooted misogyny of the society. Much to the chagrin of his wife, Nasiruddin first got rid of little Nuri's large nose pin and long hair, which gave the child much relief.The work desk of Nurjahan Begum.She was introduced to Bangla alphabets by her mother and on the same day her father started teaching her the English and Arabic alphabets. But her exposure to the world of literature, cultural and social issues came from the gathering of stalwarts of that time, at Nasiruddin's house and also Shawgat office at 11 Wellesley Street, Kolkata. Nurjahan came in contact with literary giants, social reformists and educationist, including Kazi Nazrul Islam, Abul Mansur Ahmad, Kazi Motahar Hossain and Ibrahim Khan, who not only talked about politics but also about woman's emancipation.The Shawgat Press from where Begum was later published.Impressed by Nuri's intelligence, his grandmother renamed her as Nurjahan Begum. Upon Begum Rokeya Sakhawat Hossain's request, she was admitted to Sakhawat Memorial School at Baby Class. At school, Nuri grew up with the ideals of Begum Rokeya, the educationist and rights activist, who made it possible for Bangalee Muslim women to come out of the house and embrace the light of education. In 1942, she passed her matriculation from Sakhawat Memorial School. In 1944, she passed her intermediate examinations in philosophy, history and geography, and, in 1946, her Bachelors in ethics, philosophy and history from Lady Brabourne College.Nurjahan with her daughter Flora Nasreen Khan and husband Rokonuzzaman Khan.Nurjahan's childhood, adolescent and teen years were one with the activities of Shawgat. Observing her interest in writings and newspaper works, Nasiruddin engaged his daughter to help him with filing, pasting and other general task at Shawgat.There were large shelves containing columns of picture blocks. Little Nuri knew by heart the location of each and every block. She would rub and fetch the blocks as needed by her father. By the time, the first issue ofBegumwas published on July 20, 1947, Nurjahan was well acquainted with all the workings of a newspaper.For the first four months, Nurjahan worked as the acting editor of the weekly magazine helping the editor poet Begum Sufia Kamal with collecting, editing and selecting writings for the issues.At her birthday with daughters and grandchildren.In an interview with The Daily Star's weekly magazine Star in 2005, Nurjahan Begum had shared the story of the birth of the first Bangla magazine for women."It was very difficult to bring out the publication at that time. There was the problem of block and type, of collecting ink and paper, and of transporting the staff to and from the office during the communal riots. There were not too many women writers and hardly any women photographers. But we still managed to bring out an issue every week."When Sufia Kamal had to move to Dhaka with her husband, Nurjahan took the helm ofBegumas its editor and till date steered the women's magazine, defying all kinds of political, social and financial difficulties.Sufia Kamal and Nurjahan, with their respective families in the 1960s.In the last almost seven decades,Begumhad to shift from its office from one country to another, change address from Park Street Kolkata to Loyal Street, Patuatuli Dhaka, witness Partition, Liberation War, change of regimes, change in printing technology, but its editor, Nurjahan Begum, never wavered.  She continued to breathe life into Begum, although publications became monthly from weekly. When many other women's magazine published since the 1950s could not the stand the test of time, Begum lived on, inspiring women not to give up. In Nurjahan Begum's words:"There will always be problems that we will have to face. There will always be religious conflict, social bindings and people trying to hold us back. We can lie low for a while, but ultimately, we have to move forward. It's the only way to go."Related topic:Begum MagazineNurjahan BegumClick to commentCommentsComments PolicyJournalism without fear or favourAbout UsContact UsAppsComment PolicyRSSSitemapAdvertisementNewsletterPrivacy PolicyConference HallArchives© 2025 thedailystar.net | Powered by:RSI LABCopyright: Any unauthorized use or reproduction of The Daily Star content for commercial purposes is strictly prohibited and constitutes copyright infringement liable to legal action. Nurjahan came in contact with literary giants, social reformists and educationist, including Kazi Nazrul Islam, Abul Mansur Ahmad, Kazi Motahar Hossain and Ibrahim Khan, who not only talked about politics but also about woman's emancipation.The Shawgat Press from where Begum was later published.Impressed by Nuri's intelligence, his grandmother renamed her as Nurjahan Begum. Upon Begum Rokeya Sakhawat Hossain's request, she was admitted to Sakhawat Memorial School at Baby Class. At school, Nuri grew up with the ideals of Begum Rokeya, the educationist and rights activist, who made it possible for Bangalee Muslim women to come out of the house and embrace the light of education. In 1942, she passed her matriculation from Sakhawat Memorial School. In 1944, she passed her intermediate examinations in philosophy, history and geography, and, in 1946, her Bachelors in ethics, philosophy and history from Lady Brabourne College.Nurjahan with her daughter Flora Nasreen Khan and husband Rokonuzzaman Khan.Nurjahan's childhood, adolescent and teen years were one with the activities of Shawgat. Observing her interest in writings and newspaper works, Nasiruddin engaged his daughter to help him with filing, pasting and other general task at Shawgat.There were large shelves containing columns of picture blocks. Little Nuri knew by heart the location of each and every block. She would rub and fetch the blocks as needed by her father. By the time, the first issue ofBegumwas published on July 20, 1947, Nurjahan was well acquainted with all the workings of a newspaper.For the first four months, Nurjahan worked as the acting editor of the weekly magazine helping the editor poet Begum Sufia Kamal with collecting, editing and selecting writings for the issues.At her birthday with daughters and grandchildren.In an interview with The Daily Star's weekly magazine Star in 2005, Nurjahan Begum had shared the story of the birth of the first Bangla magazine for women."It was very difficult to bring out the publication at that time. There was the problem of block and type, of collecting ink and paper, and of transporting the staff to and from the office during the communal riots. There were not too many women writers and hardly any women photographers. But we still managed to bring out an issue every week."When Sufia Kamal had to move to Dhaka with her husband, Nurjahan took the helm ofBegumas its editor and till date steered the women's magazine, defying all kinds of political, social and financial difficulties.Sufia Kamal and Nurjahan, with their respective families in the 1960s.In the last almost seven decades,Begumhad to shift from its office from one country to another, change address from Park Street Kolkata to Loyal Street, Patuatuli Dhaka, witness Partition, Liberation War, change of regimes, change in printing technology, but its editor, Nurjahan Begum, never wavered.  She continued to breathe life into Begum, although publications became monthly from weekly. When many other women's magazine published since the 1950s could not the stand the test of time, Begum lived on, inspiring women not to give up. In Nurjahan Begum's words:"There will always be problems that we will have to face. There will always be religious conflict, social bindings and people trying to hold us back. We can lie low for a while, but ultimately, we have to move forward. It's the only way to go."Related topic:Begum MagazineNurjahan BegumClick to commentCommentsComments Policy Nurjahan Begum at 100: A life for women’s voicesIn FocusIn FocusOriginally published on May 20, 2016, this article is being reprinted to celebrate the 100th birth anniversary of Nurjahan Begum, the editor and publisher of Begum, the first magazine for Bangalee Muslim women.ByTamanna KhanThu Dec 25, 2025 04:20 PMLast update on: Thu Dec 25, 2025 04:58 PMThe colourful and picturesque pages of the National Geographic magazines were what enchanted little "Nuri" and sowed the seed of journalism in her.She developed such a keen interest for the foreign and local magazines and books that her father, Mohammad Nasiruddin, renowned journalist and editor of the monthly Shawgat, brought so that she could file the publications separately just by looking at the pictures, even before she had learned to read properly.Although little Nuri, initially named as Nurun Nahar, was born in Chalitatali village of Chandpur district on June 4, 1925, two accidents brought her to Kolkata, the cultural hub of the then Bengal.The strict, conservative Muslim families of East Bengal then used to view Kolkata as a city which beguiled women from religious path. documents.title: Fire at warehouse on Gulistan building roof now under control
documents.body: Skip to main content  E-paperবাংলা Accidents & FiresStar Online ReportFri Dec 26, 2025 06:39 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 08:08 PMMost Viewed'This country belongs to people of the hills and plains, Muslims, Hindus, Buddhists and Christians'Tarique Rahman returns home after 17 years in exileA psychological reset for BNP, a moment of political recalibration for BangladeshZubaida, daughter Zaima reach Gulshan residenceAccidents & FiresAccidents & FiresFire at warehouse on Gulistan building roof now under controlFri Dec 26, 2025 06:39 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 08:08 PMThe blaze was brought under control around 6:58pmStar Online ReportFri Dec 26, 2025 06:39 PM      Last update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 08:08 PMPhoto: StarA fire broke out this evening at a warehouse located on the roof of an eight-storey commercial building, Khaddar Bazar Shopping Complex, in Gulistan.The fire was reported around 5:28pm, and the first firefighting unit reached the scene at 5:33pm, fire officials said.For all latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel.According to fire officials, the blaze was brought under control around 6:58pm.Nine firefighting units were working to bring the blaze under control, said Anwarul Islam, an official of the Fire Service and Civil Defence media wing.No casualties were reported immediately, and the cause of the fire could not be confirmed yet.Click to commentCommentsComments Policy|বাংলাদেশহাদি হত্যার বিচার দাবি: রাতে অবস্থান চলবে শাহবাগে, দেশব্যাপী অবরোধের হুঁশিয়ারিহাদি হত্যার ন্যায়বিচার নিশ্চিতে যা যা করা হয়েছে, উপদেষ্টাদের শাহবাগে এসে তার ব্যাখ্যা দেওয়ার দাবি জানিয়েছে ইনকিলাব মঞ্চ।৪১ মিনিট আগে|রাজনীতিজাতীয় স্মৃতিসৌধে তারেক রহমানের শ্রদ্ধা নিবেদন১ ঘণ্টা আগেJournalism without fear or favourAbout documents.title: Farmer killed in elephant attack at Ctg’s Banshkhali Eco Park
documents.body: Skip to main content  E-paperবাংলা BangladeshStaff Correspondent, CtgFri Dec 26, 2025 08:39 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 08:43 PMMost Viewed'This country belongs to people of the hills and plains, Muslims, Hindus, Buddhists and Christians'Tarique Rahman returns home after 17 years in exileA psychological reset for BNP, a moment of political recalibration for BangladeshZubaida, daughter Zaima reach Gulshan residenceBangladeshBangladeshFarmer killed in elephant attack at Ctg’s Banshkhali Eco ParkFri Dec 26, 2025 08:39 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 08:43 PMEco Park is adjacent to Chunati Wildlife Sanctuary – home to a herd of 60-65 wild elephantsStaff Correspondent, CtgFri Dec 26, 2025 08:39 PM      Last update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 08:43 PMBanshkhali Eco Park. File PhotoA farmer was killed in an elephant attack at Banshkhali Eco Park in Chattogram this morning.The deceased was identified as Kamal Uddin, 45, a resident of Chambal union under the upazila.For all latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel.Anisuzzaman Sheikh, deputy ranger of the Chattogram Wildlife Management Division, told The Daily Star that the forest department received information around 10:00am, and a team later recovered the body from the park area.He said some portions of land inside the eco park are privately owned, and Kamal used to cultivate crops on one such plot. The attack occurred when he went to his farmland in the morning."The victim sustained severe injuries to his head and chest after being attacked by an elephant," Anisuzzaman said, adding that the body was handed over to the family after recovery.Banshkhali Eco Park is adjacent to the Chunati Wildlife Sanctuary, which is home to a herd of around 60 to 65 wild elephants. The animals frequently roam between the sanctuary and surrounding areas, increasing the risk of human-elephant conflict.Click to commentCommentsComments Policy|বাংলাদেশহাদি হত্যার বিচার দাবি: রাতে অবস্থান চলবে শাহবাগে, দেশব্যাপী অবরোধের হুঁশিয়ারিহাদি হত্যার ন্যায়বিচার নিশ্চিতে যা যা করা হয়েছে, উপদেষ্টাদের শাহবাগে এসে তার ব্যাখ্যা দেওয়ার দাবি জানিয়েছে ইনকিলাব মঞ্চ।৪১ মিনিট আগে|রাজনীতিজাতীয় স্মৃতিসৌধে তারেক রহমানের শ্রদ্ধা নিবেদন১ ঘণ্টা আগেJournalism without fear or favourAbout UsContact UsAppsComment PolicyRSSSitemapAdvertisementNewsletterPrivacy PolicyConference HallArchives© 2025 thedailystar.net | Powered by:RSI LABCopyright: Any unauthorized use or reproduction of The Daily Star content for commercial purposes is strictly prohibited and constitutes copyright infringement liable to legal action. documents.title: Rishad claims best Big Bash figures as Hobart beat Perth
documents.body: Skip to main content  E-paperবাংলা CricketStar Sports ReportFri Dec 26, 2025 09:08 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 09:16 PMMost Viewed'This country belongs to people of the hills and plains, Muslims, Hindus, Buddhists and Christians'Tarique Rahman returns home after 17 years in exileA psychological reset for BNP, a moment of political recalibration for BangladeshZubaida, daughter Zaima reach Gulshan residenceCricketCricketRishad claims best Big Bash figures as Hobart beat PerthFri Dec 26, 2025 09:08 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 09:16 PMStar Sports ReportFri Dec 26, 2025 09:08 PM      Last update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 09:16 PMPhoto: XRishad Hossain continued his impressive run in the Big Bash League on Friday, producing his best figures of the season to set up a four-wicket victory for the Hobart Hurricanes against the Perth Scorchers at Perth Stadium.The leg-spinner returned figures of 3-33, bettering his previous best of 2-33 against the Melbourne Stars earlier this month, as Hobart restricted Perth to 150 for eight. Rishad played a crucial role in breaking momentum at key stages, allowing the Hurricanes to keep a firm grip on the Scorchers' innings.For all latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel.Introduced in the fifth over of the Powerplay, Rishad conceded nine runs in his first over after Perth opener Finn Allen struck a six. He bounced back immediately after the Powerplay, though, trapping hard-hitter Cooper Connolly (6 off seven balls) with a well-disguised googly in the seventh over. Connolly attempted a big shot over the off side but skewed the flighted delivery straight to long-off. Despite conceding a boundary off the final ball, Rishad gave away 10 runs in that over.Rishad struck again in his third over -- the 10th of the innings -- removing Aaron Hardie for nine off 10 balls. This time, he enjoyed a slice of luck as Hardie mistimed a length ball on middle and leg, offering a leading edge that was safely taken at short fine leg. Only four runs came from that over.With Perth eyeing a late surge through Nick Hobson (22 off 14 balls) and Laurie Evans (19 off 15 balls), and the score reading 123 for five after 15 overs, Rishad was brought back to bowl at the death. After conceding a couple and a six off his first two balls of the 16th over, he responded with flight and guile, luring Evans, who made 27 off 18 balls, into a stumping. The remaining deliveries of the over yielded just two runs.Allen's team-highest 43 off 23 balls and Hobson's eventual 29 off 23 helped Perth reach 150 for eight. Hobart, however, made light work of the chase as Tim David smashed 42 off 28 balls and Macalister Wright added a brisk 22 off 13 deliveries. After a slower 30 off 34 balls from Nikhil Chaudhury, the Hurricanes crossed the line in 19.3 overs.The win was Hobart's third in four matches, placing them second on the standings with six points, behind Melbourne Stars (on net run rate), who have three wins from three games.Rishad now has six wickets from four matches this season, conceding runs at an economy rate of 7.50.Related topic:Big Bash LeagueBBLRishad Hossainbangladesh cricketHobart HurricanesClick to commentCommentsComments PolicyRelated NewsPakistan wants ICC to regulate growth of T20 leagues3y agoICC WTC 2025–27: Where each team stand as the race heats up3d agoRishad ‘regrets misunderstanding’ caused by his comments on PSL teammates7m agoTigers eye gains from ‘different’ skill camp1w agoCurran handed four-match Big Bash ban for intimidating umpire2y ago|বাংলাদেশহাদি হত্যার বিচার দাবি: রাতে অবস্থান চলবে শাহবাগে, দেশব্যাপী অবরোধের হুঁশিয়ারিহাদি হত্যার ন্যায়বিচার নিশ্চিতে যা যা করা হয়েছে, উপদেষ্টাদের শাহবাগে এসে তার ব্যাখ্যা দেওয়ার দাবি জানিয়েছে ইনকিলাব মঞ্চ।৪১ মিনিট আগে|রাজনীতিজাতীয় স্মৃতিসৌধে তারেক রহমানের শ্রদ্ধা নিবেদন১ ঘণ্টা আগেJournalism without fear or favourAbout UsContact UsAppsComment PolicyRSSSitemapAdvertisementNewsletterPrivacy PolicyConference HallArchives© 2025 thedailystar.net | Powered by:RSI LABCopyright: Any unauthorized use or reproduction of The Daily Star content for commercial purposes is strictly prohibited and constitutes copyright infringement liable to legal action. Rishad played a crucial role in breaking momentum at key stages, allowing the Hurricanes to keep a firm grip on the Scorchers' innings.For all latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel.Introduced in the fifth over of the Powerplay, Rishad conceded nine runs in his first over after Perth opener Finn Allen struck a six. He bounced back immediately after the Powerplay, though, trapping hard-hitter Cooper Connolly (6 off seven balls) with a well-disguised googly in the seventh over. Connolly attempted a big shot over the off side but skewed the flighted delivery straight to long-off. Despite conceding a boundary off the final ball, Rishad gave away 10 runs in that over.Rishad struck again in his third over -- the 10th of the innings -- removing Aaron Hardie for nine off 10 balls. This time, he enjoyed a slice of luck as Hardie mistimed a length ball on middle and leg, offering a leading edge that was safely taken at short fine leg. Only four runs came from that over.With Perth eyeing a late surge through Nick Hobson (22 off 14 balls) and Laurie Evans (19 off 15 balls), and the score reading 123 for five after 15 overs, Rishad was brought back to bowl at the death. After conceding a couple and a six off his first two balls of the 16th over, he responded with flight and guile, luring Evans, who made 27 off 18 balls, into a stumping. The remaining deliveries of the over yielded just two runs.Allen's team-highest 43 off 23 balls and Hobson's eventual 29 off 23 helped Perth reach 150 for eight. Hobart, however, made light work of the chase as Tim David smashed 42 off 28 balls and Macalister Wright added a brisk 22 off 13 deliveries. After a slower 30 off 34 balls from Nikhil Chaudhury, the Hurricanes crossed the line in 19.3 overs.The win was Hobart's third in four matches, placing them second on the standings with six points, behind Melbourne Stars (on net run rate), who have three wins from three games.Rishad now has six wickets from four matches this season, conceding runs at an economy rate of 7.50.Related topic:Big documents.title: Two bulkhead crew members die after being hit by launch in Narayanganj
documents.body: Skip to main content  E-paperবাংলা Accidents & FiresOur Correspondent, NarayanganjFri Dec 26, 2025 06:59 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 07:05 PMMost Viewed'This country belongs to people of the hills and plains, Muslims, Hindus, Buddhists and Christians'Tarique Rahman returns home after 17 years in exileA psychological reset for BNP, a moment of political recalibration for BangladeshZubaida, daughter Zaima reach Gulshan residenceAccidents & FiresAccidents & FiresTwo bulkhead crew members die after being hit by launch in NarayanganjFri Dec 26, 2025 06:59 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 07:05 PMAccident happened while the victims were sleeping in the engine roomOur Correspondent, NarayanganjFri Dec 26, 2025 06:59 PM      Last update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 07:05 PMPhoto: Saurav Hossain Siam/StarAccident happened while the victims were sleeping in the engine roomTwo crew members of a bulkhead were killed when the sand-laden vessel capsized after being rammed by a launch on the Buriganga river in Fatullah, Narayanganj early today .The victims were identified as Mohammad Zohurul Islam Shakil, 25, son of Amir Hawladar of Chargorabdi village in Dumki upazila of Patuakhali, and Md Hasan, 20, of Rajapur upazila in Jhalakathi district.For all latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel.The bulkhead sank around 6:15am in the Dharmaganj area while it was anchored in the river, said Kamrul Hasan, assistant director of the Bangladesh Inland Water Transport Authority (BIWTA).Kamrul Hasan said the two crew members were sleeping inside the engine room at the time of the incident.Following the incident, members of the Coast Guard, Fire Service and Civil Defence, and BIWTA launched a rescue operations, he said.Inspector Akibul Islam, in-charge of Pagla River Police Outpost, said the bulkhead, MV Kashfa Sneha, was anchored in the river when it was hit by the Dhaka-bound launch Sundarban-16, causing it to capsize.While three crew members managed to swim ashore, two others – Zohurul and Hasan – remained trapped inside.Bulkhead driver Nannu Mia said all crew members had been asleep when the incident occurred."I woke up to a loud bang and realised the vessel was sinking," he said, adding that, "I somehow broke a glass window and managed to get out."Click to commentCommentsComments Policy|বাংলাদেশহাদি হত্যার বিচার দাবি: রাতে অবস্থান চলবে শাহবাগে, দেশব্যাপী অবরোধের হুঁশিয়ারিহাদি হত্যার ন্যায়বিচার নিশ্চিতে যা যা করা হয়েছে, উপদেষ্টাদের শাহবাগে এসে তার ব্যাখ্যা দেওয়ার দাবি জানিয়েছে ইনকিলাব মঞ্চ।৪১ মিনিট আগে|রাজনীতিজাতীয় স্মৃতিসৌধে residenceAccidents & FiresAccidents & FiresTwo bulkhead crew members die after being hit by launch in NarayanganjFri Dec 26, 2025 06:59 PMLast update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 07:05 PMAccident happened while the victims were sleeping in the engine roomOur Correspondent, NarayanganjFri Dec 26, 2025 06:59 PM      Last update on: Fri Dec 26, 2025 07:05 PMPhoto: Saurav Hossain Siam/StarAccident happened while the victims were sleeping in the engine roomTwo crew members of a bulkhead were killed when the sand-laden vessel capsized after being rammed by a launch on the Buriganga river in Fatullah, Narayanganj early today .The victims were identified as Mohammad Zohurul Islam Shakil, 25, son of Amir Hawladar of Chargorabdi village in Dumki upazila of Patuakhali, and Md Hasan, 20, of Rajapur upazila in Jhalakathi district.For all latest news, follow The Daily Star's Google News channel.The bulkhead sank around 6:15am in the Dharmaganj area while it was anchored in the river, said Kamrul Hasan, assistant director of the Bangladesh Inland Water Transport Authority (BIWTA).Kamrul Hasan said the two crew members were sleeping inside the engine room at the time of the incident.Following the incident, members of the Coast Guard, Fire Service and Civil Defence, and BIWTA launched a rescue operations, he said.Inspector Akibul Islam, in-charge of Pagla River Police Outpost, said the bulkhead, MV Kashfa Sneha, was anchored in the river when it was hit by the Dhaka-bound launch Sundarban-16, causing it to capsize.While three crew members managed to swim ashore, two others – Zohurul and Hasan – remained trapped inside.Bulkhead driver Nannu Mia said all crew members had been asleep when the incident occurred."I woke up to a loud bang and realised the vessel was sinking," he said, adding that, "I somehow broke a glass window and managed to get out."Click to commentCommentsComments Policy|বাংলাদেশহাদি হত্যার বিচার দাবি: রাতে অবস্থান চলবে শাহবাগে, দেশব্যাপী অবরোধের হুঁশিয়ারিহাদি
